content:
Welcome back to #define, our game of obscure jargon, fake definitions, and expert tomfoolery. We've gathered some awesome friends, new and old, to see who has the best vocabulary and who can trick the everyone else into thinking that they do. :link: https://changelog.am/93

Oh god, these are a lot of fun to listen to, and Adam is easily my favorite part.

A suggestion:

Next time you do this why not post all the answers in a group chat so that they aren't asking you repeat them over and over again.

Also people kept saying "I know this" which seems to defeat the purpose of the game. Maybe they are just bluffing or something because they often chose the wrong answer anyway but it seems like if you know the answer then everybody else would choose the same answer as you right?

I've considered posting the answers, but that would require a lot of cleanup/editing by me first as there's lots of spelling/etc issues that could be tells.

Anybody who actually knows what the word is scores 3 points right away and sits the round out. Everybody else is just bluffing.
